components.description:
A yellow face with small, open eyes, a slight frown, and furrowed eyebrows, from which a single bead of sweat drips, as if from concern or anxiety. Also known as Disappointed but Relieved Face, suggesting the smiley is upset but is grateful things didn’t turn out worse.

Commonly conveys mild degrees of frustration and sadness. Not to be confused with ðŸ˜¢ Crying Face, ðŸ˜ª Sleepy Face, or other emojis with tear or sweat droplets.
components.title: Disappointed but Relieved Face

description:
A yellow face with small, open eyes, a slight frown, and furrowed eyebrows, from which a single bead of sweat drips, as if from concern or anxiety. Also known as Disappointed but Relieved Face, suggesting the smiley is upset but is grateful things didn’t turn out worse.

Commonly conveys mild degrees of frustration and sadness. Not to be confused with ðŸ˜¢ Crying Face, ðŸ˜ª Sleepy Face, or other emojis with tear or sweat droplets.
title: Disappointed but Relieved Face

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: This faceÂ has sweat dripping from its brow, due to a stressful situation. Not to be confused with the Crying Face emoji, which has a tear on http://emojipedia.org/disappointed-but-relieved-face/
emoji_net_data.name: disappointed but relieved face

bn:00110036a: Feeling mentally uncomfortable because something is missing or wrong.
Experiencing or showing sorrow or unhappiness- Christina Rossetti

bn:00107231a: Easily agitated or alarmed; on edge or edgy.

bn:00091564v: Excrete perspiration through the pores in the skin
To emit sweat or perspiration through the skin's pores.

bn:00086883v: Fail to meet the hopes or expectations of

bn:00084388v: To cry out with a shrill voice; to utter a sudden, sharp outcry, or shrill, loud cry, as in fright or extreme pain; to shriek; to screech.
To utter a sudden and loud outcry, as in joy, triumph, or exultation, or to attract attention, to animate soldiers, etc.
To utter a sudden and loud outcry.
To speak with a loud, excited voice.
To utter in a loud or distinct voice.

bn:00032600n: Part of the body at the front of the head
The face is a central organ of sense and is also very central in the expression of emotion among humans and among numerous other species.
Faces are the central sense organ complexes, for those animals that have one, normally on the ventral surface of the head.
The front of the human head from the forehead to the chin and ear to ear
The front part of the head, featuring the eyes, nose, and mouth and the surrounding area.

bn:00027430n: Disappointment is the feeling of dissatisfaction that follows the failure of expectations to manifest.
A feeling of dissatisfaction that results when your expectations are not realized
The emotion felt when a strongly held expectation is not met.
Disappointment is the feeling of dissatisfaction that follows the failure of expectations or hopes to manifest.

bn:00076312n: A single tear (clear, salty liquid secreted by the eye).
A drop of clear, salty liquid produced from the eyes by crying or irritation.

A clear, salty liquid produced by the lacrimal gland in the eye, whose normal function is to clean and lubricate the eyes; its production is increased when the eye is irritated, or when yawning, laughing or crying.
A drop of liquid produced from the eyes by crying or irritation.
A drop of the clear salty saline solution secreted by the lacrimal glands
Drop of clear salty liquid from the eyes.

bn:00029899n: The use of forces and means higher than normal in order to achieve a given purpose.
An expenditure of physical or mental effort.
The work involved in performing an activity; exertion.
Elbow grease is an idiom for working hard at manual labor, as in "You need to use some elbow grease."
Use of physical or mental energy; hard work

Effort, in physical terms, is the amount of work involved in performing an activity; in general use it is also synonymous with Endeavor, which implies a deliberate exertion, and to use more energy than usual in an activity.
Effort or hard work, especially physical work involving repeated motion of the forearm, such as scrubbing.
Exertion is the use of physical or perceived energy.
